title: Understandable AI paranoia has inspired a developer to change the handcrafted character art in its upcoming sim: 'They look a bit AI'
partialText: Transport Fever 3's characters look pretty uncanny, and that's a bigger problem than it used to be.

title: Nvidia dumps its $140 million stake in Arm but licensing deals remain and its new PC CPU is still go
partialText: Nvidia once planned to take full control of Arm.

title: Birdwatching Notebook is meant to be a relaxing idler, but it drove me to new depths of unlock-obsessed birdmania
partialText: Birds of a feather flock together as long as you've placed a berry bush.

title: The new game from Disco Elysium's studio feels like the first Christmas after your parents' divorce
partialText: It ain't never gonna be what it was.

title: I romanced a hunky British man with a shotgun for a head in a game that lets me have 'US government approved pronouns' like Jamestown, grits, and freedom
partialText: Polyarmory: High-Calibre Love is one of the funniest, stupidest, most incredible names for a videogame I've ever seen.

title: Dutch police have arrested a man for reportedly refusing to relinquish files they sent him: 'He would only comply if he received something in return'
partialText: Note to self, don't download files from the police and refuse to send them back.

title: Nvidia's DLSS upscaling beats AMD's FSR and plain old native rendering at 4K in a poll of over 1,000 gamers
partialText: Upscaling is only becoming more important.

title: New research suggests folks are relying on 'outdated visual cues' to identify AI-generated faces—but I did get 14/20 on the test
partialText: Can you do any better?

title: WoW's classes were pruned for Midnight because many were 'built in a world' where its devs assumed they'd be using addons
partialText: "We settled into an expectation."

title: Obsidian was 'surprised' that Avowed players bounced off one of the RPG's most important systems: 'That frustration came through loud and clear'
partialText: Who's got time to upgrade their gear when there are adventures to be had?

title: Firefox is finally ending support for Windows 7, 8, and 8.1, and urges users to upgrade or switch to Linux
partialText: Mozilla notes, "most browsers, including Google Chrome and Microsoft Edge, have already ended support for Windows 7, 8 and 8.1."

title: Avowed's massive anniversary update adds new playable races, but they don't get any unique dialogue because there were 'no dedicated narrative people available'
partialText: The new races are just a "mechanical distinction".

title: Fill out our quick questionnaire about your gaming habits and you could nab a $300 Amazon voucher
partialText: We hunger for your takes.

title: Jensen Huang teases reveal of 'a chip that will surprise the world' at next month's GTC
partialText: Looking ahead.

title: The 'LeBron James of spreadsheets' thought Excel becoming a popular esport was 'unlikely' before winning the grand prize in Las Vegas
partialText: 'You can have a lot more fun with Excel than people realise.'

title: Devil Daggers 2 is in development, as its creator confirms fewer than 1,500 people survived longer than 8 minutes in the original
partialText: Because it's as scary as it is hard.

title: The Killing Stone combines occult contract law with card-battling in an isolated 17th century mansion
partialText: Something is rotten in Little Denmark.

title: Todd Howard says Bethesda will return to 'that classic style' for Elder Scrolls 6: 'Fallout 76 and Starfield are a little bit of a creative detour'
partialText: And it'll be powered by an upgraded engine.

title: Surprise, surprise: The ROG Xbox Ally X just got a AU$200 price hike in Australia
partialText: Why? I think you can guess.

title: Can you guess which videogame these zombies are from? Take our quiz and evaluate your mastery over the undead!
partialText: Or at least zombie adjacent.

title: As Destiny 2's player count continues to tank, Bungie announces that the next major update is delayed until June and getting a new name
partialText: The delay comes as no surprise, but the length is unexpected.

title: Videogames are 'losing in the War for Attention': Analyst says many of the industry's biggest markets are spending less time on gaming
partialText: It's a crowded battlefield.

title: Spooky visual novel The Mermaid's Curse is the best kind of sequel: a self-contained mystery
partialText: Paranormasight: The Mermaid's Curse is better for not caring if you've played the first game.

title: Todd Howard says there's no Starfield 2.0 coming: The next big update is for people who already love Starfield, and if you don't, 'I don't think this is going to change that'
partialText: Bethesda will start talking about the future of Starfield "really soon," but he warned that it may not be all that some fans are hoping for.

title: DICE has 'heard the message very clear' and is now prioritizing larger maps for Battlefield 6, but 'it takes a really long time'
partialText: Battlefield 6 Season 2 launched with another decently-sized map in Contaminated, but fans want even bigger.

title: Poppy Playtime becomes Steam's global top seller and doubles its all-time peak player count record
partialText: Everyone wants to play with Chapter 5's "Wrongside Outimals."

title: Congrats, you played yourself, Arc Raiders' machines aren't actually learning: 'That's just the way we author them'
partialText: Players had begun to wonder whether the robot enemies were using AI to learn new tactics based on player behaviour, but Embark has shot the theory down.

title: Black Ops 7 ad banned in the UK for 'trivializing sexual violence'
partialText: The ad features Peter Stormare and Nicki Glaser as "Replacers" in an airport security line.

title: Microsoft's ties with ICE come under fire amidst allegations that the company's cloud and AI technology are being used to support mass surveillance of US citizens
partialText: No Azure for Apartheid statement comes the day after reports claiming that ICE has tripled the amount of data stored on Microsoft's Azure servers over the past six months.

title: Microsoft uses plagiarized AI slop flowchart to explain how Github works, removes it after original creator calls it out: 'Careless, blatantly amateuristic, and lacking any ambition, to put it gently'
partialText: The official Introduction to Github page included an AI-generated graphic with the phrase "continvoucly morged" on it, among other mistakes.

title: Embark admits Arc Raiders’ bosses are dying too fast because 'they're not intended for the full server to go up against' and 'we gave players too effective abilities'
partialText: "When we built that, we had an idealised way where we hoped people would try to engage with it".

title: All the Sims 4 Royalty & Legacy cheats you need to attain a noble lifestyle without the effort
partialText: Get all the traits and skill cheats for Royalty & Legacy plus some other handy dynasty and favor controls.

title: I didn't expect to kidnap alligators, save Woodstock or give people dysentery in a game called Transport Fever 3—but here we are
partialText: It's OK, I released the alligators.

title: And I thought DDR5 prices were bad: Samsung is apparently charging $700 for its latest AI-empowering HBM product
partialText: No joke, but maybe a little funny.

title: Arc Raiders' matchmaking isn't 'binary', says design lead: 'There's no such thing as a friendly lobby or an aggressive lobby'
partialText: "We acknowledge that people are having a lot of fun with these safer lobbies".

title: New research claims pretty much all headphones contain toxic chemicals that 'may be migrating' into our bodies
partialText: Add this to your list of things to worry about.

title: 'The AI era is no longer a distant promise; it is a present reality,' Google declares in a report that also claims its AI principles are the 'north star standards'
partialText: Google also promises to fix all the holes that have popped up in the AI ship as it's hurtled forward.

title: Japanese toilet manufacturer reportedly 'most undervalued and overlooked' beneficiary of AI boom
partialText: Flush with cash.

title: Arc Raiders design director says players 'never worked together' in testing, but the emergence of care bear lobbies 'encourages us to lean toward giving opportunities to have friendly interactions'
partialText: Catering to both PvE and PvP-heavy audiences is a "precarious position".

title: Valve wins lawsuit against Rothschild and associated entities, with a jury agreeing they violated an anti-patent troll protection act
partialText: The court also agreed that they had breached a global license agreement with Valve.

title: After a glitch botched Overwatch's first big post-reboot event, it's sending out the rewards—including 14 lootboxes—out to players anyway
partialText: Mmm, sweet lootboxes.

title: DayZ creator calls to 'normalize delaying games,' that consumers can show Xbox and Sony 'that delays are okay' and, oh, 'Personally: don't preorder games, folks. Commercially: please preorder games'
partialText: "It's the only way PlayStation/Xbox notice us."

title: Moza AB9 FFB Base + MH16 Flightstick + MTP Throttle review
partialText: One for the serious flight simmers, but a very impressive experience.

title: Three of the biggest password managers are vulnerable to 'a cornucopia of practical attacks' say security researchers
partialText: But post-its aren't the way either.

title: NZXT's latest mini-ITX PC case looks seriously nifty, I'm just not sure how I'm going to afford the RAM for the build...
partialText: If you want a desktop PC that actually fits on your desktop...

title: Yes, Chinese DRAM is fine for gaming but don't think for one moment that any of it is a bargain
partialText: But if you can find something that's reasonably priced, by all means grab it while you can.

title: Everyone should get into birdwatching, and as a birdwatching devotee, here are the 4 upcoming birding games on Steam I'm keeping tabs on
partialText: Fly from biome to biome and see what you can find.

title: The demo of Sucker for Love: Crush Landing is the gentle reminder I needed that dating an eldritch god wouldn't be straightforward, actually
partialText: Sometimes you've got to be willing to put in the work.

title: Deadlock's snazziest rich boy, Apollo, gets struck down by a bunch of nerfs after terrorising matches: 'Yoshi took him out back'
partialText: Nerfed in Flawless Advance.

title: Windows 11 is getting a handy internet speed test built right into the taskbar
partialText: Plus a load of other quite welcome tweaks, fixes and enhancements.
